ti

Class Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • ti.Index

  • public class Index
extends Object
    This class represents the index of the search engine.

    The structures it holds are: the term and document information, an inverse index, a direct index, and a cached version of the documents.

    The index can be loaded from and saved to some specified directory.

    • Field Detail

      • DOCS_PER_CACHE_BLOCK

        protected final int DOCS_PER_CACHE_BLOCK
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • path

        protected String path

      • vocabulary

        public HashMap<String,Tuple<Integer,Double>> vocabulary
        The vocabulary of terms in the index.

        [term] -> (termID, IDF)

        It maps a term String onto a Tuple containing the termID and its IDF score.

      • documents

        public ArrayList<Tuple<String,Double>> documents
        The list of documents in the index.

        [docID] -> (docName, norm)

        The i-th element is a Tuple corresponding to the document with docID=i. The Tuple contains the name of the document and its vector norm.

      • invertedIndex

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<Tuple<Integer,Double>>> invertedIndex
        The inverted index.

        [termID] -> (docID, weight)+

        The i-th element corresponds to the postings list of the term with termID=i. Each posting is a Tuple containing a docID and the weight of the term in that document.

      • directIndex

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<Tuple<Integer,Double>>> directIndex
        The direct index.

        [docID] -> (termID, weight)+

        The i-th element corresponds to the postings list of the document with docID=i. Each posting is a Tuple containing a termID and the weight of that term in the document.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Index

        public Index(String path)
        Creates a new index to be loaded from or stored in the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        path - the directory to store the index files.

    • Method Detail

      • getCachedDocument

        public Tuple<String,String> getCachedDocument(int docID)
                                       throws Exception
        Returns the cached version of the specified document.
        Parameters:
        docID - the ID of the document.
        Returns:
        a Tuple containing the document title and its body.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs while accessing the cache.

      • setCachedDocument

        public void setCachedDocument(int docID,
                     Tuple<String,String> docText)
                       throws IOException
        Sets the cached version of the specified document.
        Parameters:
        docID - the ID of the document.
        docText - a Tuple containing the document title and its body.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while accessing the cache.

      • load

        public void load()
          throws Exception
        Loads the index from the path specified in the constructor.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs while loading the index.

      • save

        public void save()
          throws IOException
        Saves the index to the path specified in the constructor.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while saving the index.

      • printStatistics

        public void printStatistics()
        Prints statistics about the index to System.err. The statistics include the number of terms in the vocabulary and its size, the number of documents and the size of the cache, and the size of the direct and inverted indexes.
